meanings.definition: Inclined to exercise arbitrary and overbearing control over others
meanings.sent1: The domineering boss always made decisions without considering others' opinions.
meanings.sent2: She had a domineering personality, always wanting things done her way.
meanings.sent3: The domineering cat demanded to be fed at the same time every day.
meanings.sent4: Her domineering presence in the room silenced everyone else.
meanings.sent5: The domineering storm clouds loomed overhead, ready to unleash their power.

meanings.definition: Asserting one's will over others in an arrogant way
meanings.sent1: He was known for his domineering behavior, always expecting others to follow his orders.
meanings.sent2: The domineering politician believed he was always right and never listened to opposing views.
meanings.sent3: The domineering squirrel hoarded all the nuts in the park, refusing to share with others.
meanings.sent4: Her domineering gaze seemed to pierce through anyone who dared to challenge her.
meanings.sent5: The domineering mountain stood tall, casting a shadow over the entire valley.
